etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French basile, via medieval Latin from Greek basilikon, neuter of basilikos ‘royal’ (see basilica)

definitions: an aromatic annual herb of the mint family, native to tropical Asia.

notes.text: Genus Ocimum, family Labiatae: several species, in particular the common sweet basil (O. basilicum) and the low-growing, compact bush basilO. minimum

shortDefinitions: aromatic annual herb of mint family

definitions: the leaves of the basil plant used as a culinary herb, especially in Mediterranean dishes.
shortDefinitions: leaves of this plant used as culinary herb
